identity not established anyhow. But you know, that ad hoc, ad hoc selection, I
escaped many times those things because I had no triangle.

The following oral history testimony is the result of a taped interview with Anna Palarczyk,
conducted on August 16-7, 1996 on behalf of the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum. The
interview 1s part of the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum's collection of oral testimonies.
Rights to the interview are held by the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum.

The reader should bear in mind that this is a verbatim transcript of spoken, rather than
written prose. This transcript has been neither checked for spelling nor verified for accuracy, and
therefore, it 1s possible that there are errors. As a result, nothing should be quoted or used from this
transcript without first checking it against the taped interview.

HELEN TICHAUER AND ANNA PALARCZYK
August 16-7, 1996
